verses.kjv: And Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called for the elders of Israel, and for their heads, and for their judges, and for their officers; and they presented themselves before God.
verses.ct: Joshua assembled all the tribes of Israel at Shechem. He summoned the elders, leaders, judges, and officials of Israel, and they stood in the presence of God.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto all the people, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Your fathers dwelt on the other side of the flood in old time, even Terah, the father of Abraham, and the father of Nachor: and they served other gods.
verses.ct: Joshua addressed all the people: "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'Long ago your ancestors lived beyond the Euphrates River, including Terah, the father of Abraham and Nachor. They worshiped other gods.

verses.kjv: And I took your father Abraham from the other side of the flood, and led him throughout all the land of Canaan, and multiplied his seed, and gave him Isaac.
verses.ct: But I took your ancestor Abraham from beyond the Euphrates River and guided him through the entire land of Canaan. I gave him many descendants and gave him Isaac.

verses.kjv: And I gave unto Isaac Jacob and Esau: and I gave unto Esau mount Seir, to possess it; but Jacob and his children went down into Egypt.
verses.ct: To Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the hill country of Seir as his territory, but Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.

verses.kjv: I sent Moses also and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt, according to that which I did among them: and afterward I brought you out.
verses.ct: Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I struck Egypt with plagues through what I did among them. Afterward I brought you out.

verses.kjv: And I brought your fathers out of Egypt: and ye came unto the sea; and the Egyptians pursued after your fathers with chariots and horsemen unto the Red sea.
verses.ct: When I brought your ancestors out of Egypt, you reached the sea. The Egyptians chased your ancestors with chariots and cavalry all the way to the Red Sea.

verses.kjv: And when they cried unto the LORD, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the sea upon them, and covered them; and your eyes have seen what I have done in Egypt: and ye dwelt in the wilderness a long season.
verses.ct: Your ancestors cried out to the LORD, and he placed darkness between you and the Egyptians. He brought the sea crashing over them and drowned them. You saw with your own eyes what I did in Egypt. Then you lived in the wilderness for a long time.

verses.kjv: And I brought you into the land of the Amorites, which dwelt on the other side Jordan; and they fought with you: and I gave them into your hand, that ye might possess their land; and I destroyed them from before you.
verses.ct: I brought you into the territory of the Amorites who lived east of the Jordan. They fought against you, but I gave you victory over them so you could take their land. I wiped them out ahead of you.

verses.kjv: Then Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, arose and warred against Israel, and sent and called Balaam the son of Beor to curse you:
verses.ct: Then Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, rose up and made war against Israel. He sent for Balaam son of Beor to put a curse on you.

verses.kjv: But I would not hearken unto Balaam; therefore he blessed you still: so I delivered you out of his hand.
verses.ct: But I refused to listen to Balaam. Instead, he ended up blessing you over and over. That is how I rescued you from his power.

verses.kjv: And ye went over Jordan, and came unto Jericho: and the men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Girgashites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites; and I delivered them into your hand.
verses.ct: You crossed the Jordan and arrived at Jericho. The people of Jericho fought against you, along with the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites. But I gave you victory over all of them.

verses.kjv: And I sent the hornet before you, which drave them out from before you, even the two kings of the Amorites; but not with thy sword, nor with thy bow.
verses.ct: I sent terror ahead of you that drove them out — including the 2 Amorite kings. It was not your sword or your bow that did it.

verses.kjv: And I have given you a land for which ye did not labour, and cities which ye built not, and ye dwell in them; of the vineyards and oliveyards which ye planted not do ye eat.
verses.ct: I gave you land you never worked, cities you never built — and now you live in them. You eat from vineyards and olive groves you never planted.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore fear the LORD, and serve him in sincerity and in truth: and put away the gods which your fathers served on the other side of the flood, and in Egypt; and serve ye the LORD.
verses.ct: "So now, be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD and serve him with complete sincerity and faithfulness. Get rid of the gods your ancestors worshiped beyond the Euphrates River and in Egypt, and serve the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if it seem evil unto you to serve the LORD, choose you this day whom ye will serve; whether the gods which your fathers served that were on the other side of the flood, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but as for me and my house, we will serve the LORD.
verses.ct: But if serving the LORD seems undesirable to you, then decide today who you will serve — whether the gods your ancestors worshiped beyond the Euphrates River, or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you now live. As for me and my family, we will serve the LORD."

verses.kjv: And the people answered and said, God forbid that we should forsake the LORD, to serve other gods;
verses.ct: The people responded, "We would never abandon the LORD to serve other gods!

verses.kjv: For the LORD our God, he it is that brought us up and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and which did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way wherein we went, and among all the people through whom we passed:
verses.ct: The LORD our God is the one who brought us and our ancestors up out of Egypt, out of slavery. He performed those incredible signs right in front of us. He protected us the entire journey and among all the nations we passed through.

verses.kjv: And the LORD drave out from before us all the people, even the Amorites which dwelt in the land: therefore will we also serve the LORD; for he is our God.
verses.ct: The LORD drove out all the peoples ahead of us, including the Amorites who lived in this land. So we too will serve the LORD, because he is our God."

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto the people, Ye cannot serve the LORD: for he is an holy God; he is a jealous God; he will not forgive your transgressions nor your sins.
verses.ct: Joshua told the people, "You are not able to serve the LORD, because he is a holy God. He is an exclusive God who demands total loyalty. He will not overlook your rebellion or your sins.

verses.kjv: If ye forsake the LORD, and serve strange gods, then he will turn and do you hurt, and consume you, after that he hath done you good.
verses.ct: If you abandon the LORD and serve foreign gods, he will turn against you and bring disaster on you and destroy you, even after all the good he has done for you."

verses.kjv: And the people said unto Joshua, Nay; but we will serve the LORD.
verses.ct: But the people said to Joshua, "No! We will serve the LORD."

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto the people, Ye are witnesses against yourselves that ye have chosen you the LORD, to serve him. And they said, We are witnesses.
verses.ct: Then Joshua said to the people, "You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen to serve the LORD." They replied, "We are witnesses."

verses.kjv: Now therefore put away, said he, the strange gods which are among you, and incline your heart unto the LORD God of Israel.
verses.ct: "Then get rid of the foreign gods that are among you," he said, "and turn your hearts fully to the LORD, the God of Israel."

verses.kjv: And the people said unto Joshua, The LORD our God will we serve, and his voice will we obey.
verses.ct: The people said to Joshua, "We will serve the LORD our God and obey his voice."

verses.kjv: So Joshua made a covenant with the people that day, and set them a statute and an ordinance in Shechem.
verses.ct: So that day Joshua established a covenant with the people and gave them laws and regulations at Shechem.

verses.kjv: And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the law of God, and took a great stone, and set it up there under an oak, that was by the sanctuary of the LORD.
verses.ct: Joshua recorded these words in the book of the law of God. Then he took a large stone and set it up there beneath the oak tree near the sanctuary of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said unto all the people, Behold, this stone shall be a witness unto us; for it hath heard all the words of the LORD which he spake unto us: it shall be therefore a witness unto you, lest ye deny your God.
verses.ct: Joshua said to all the people, "Look — this stone will serve as a witness for us, because it has been present for all the words the LORD spoke to us. It will stand as a witness against you if you ever turn away from your God."

verses.kjv: So Joshua let the people depart, every man unto his inheritance.
verses.ct: Then Joshua sent the people away, each to their own inherited territory.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after these things, that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died, being an hundred and ten years old.
verses.ct: After these events, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of 110.

verses.kjv: And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnathserah, which is in mount Ephraim, on the north side of the hill of Gaash.
verses.ct: They buried him within the boundaries of his territory at Timnathserah, in the hill country of Ephraim, on the north side of Mount Gaash.

verses.kjv: And Israel served the LORD all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that overlived Joshua, and which had known all the works of the LORD, that he had done for Israel.
verses.ct: Israel served the LORD throughout Joshua's lifetime and throughout the lifetime of the elders who outlived Joshua — those who had personally witnessed everything the LORD had done for Israel.

verses.kjv: And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, buried they in Shechem, in a parcel of ground which Jacob bought of the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for an hundred pieces of silver: and it became the inheritance of the children of Joseph.
verses.ct: The bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had carried up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem in the plot of land that Jacob had purchased from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for 100 pieces of silver. This land became the inheritance of Joseph's descendants.

verses.kjv: And Eleazar the son of Aaron died; and they buried him in a hill that pertained to Phinehas his son, which was given him in mount Ephraim.
verses.ct: Eleazar son of Aaron also died, and they buried him at Gibeah, the town belonging to his son Phinehas, which had been given to him in the hill country of Ephraim.
